labels.analysis: The Gaggiuino Espresso Machine Server provides real-time telemetry and data access for espresso machines running the Gaggiuino system. It enables users (including AI clients) to monitor machine status, retrieve shot data, and analyze extraction parameters. This server is focused on optimizing and analyzing espresso shots, making it a specialized tool for coffee enthusiasts and professionals.
labels.reasoning: The primary function of this server is to provide monitoring and data access for a specific machine type (espresso), which doesn't perfectly fit into any existing predefined category. However, it shares elements with hardware monitoring systems. The custom label more accurately represents its niche functionality, while the secondary label acknowledges its data analysis capabilities.

tools.name: getShotData
tools.description:
Get espresso shot data for an id.

    Args:
        id: Shot id

server_info_crawled.name: Gaggiuino Espresso Machine Server
server_info_crawled.author: @AndrewKlement/gaggiuino-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide real-time access to espresso machine telemetry and shot data for the Gaggiuino system. Enable AI clients to retrieve machine status, latest shot IDs, and detailed shot data to analyze espresso extraction. Facilitate local network integration for monitoring and optimizing espresso shots.

tools.name: getShotData
tools.description:
Get espresso shot data for an id.

    Args:
        id: Shot id

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@AndrewKlement/gaggiuino-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
